question: Who among the following had gone to England to plead the cause of the Mughal emperorÂ Akbar II, with an ambassador of the emperor?
explanation: Raja Ram Mohan Roy was a prominent social, and educational reformer of India. Ram Mohan Roy had gone to England to plead the cause of the Mughal emperor Akbar II, with an ambassador of the emperor. The title of Raja was given by Akbar II, the Mughal emperor.
